title: Zaza Pachulia - Wikipedia
snippet: On August 29, 2019, Pachulia retired from playing and re-joined the Warriors as a front office consultant in their basketball operations department. He won his third NBA championship after the Warriors defeated the Boston Celtics in six games in the 2022 NBA Finals.

title: r/nba on Reddit: Zaza Pachulia posts heartfelt retirement message as he begins ‘next chapter’
snippet: Zaza Pachulia played in the NBA for 16 seasons, winning two championships with the Golden State Warriors. Now, however, the Georgian-born ball player is ready to retire.

title: Zaza Pachulia reveals how losing over $100K on restaurant business made him a better investor - Basketball Network
snippet: However, off the court, Pachulia flipped the script completely, transforming into a successful businessman, but, like with everything in life, it did not come without early hiccups. As a matter of fact, those mistakes are exactly what Zaza admits made him a better and more responsible investor in the long run. “I invested in two restaurants when I was playing in Atlanta, and we didn’t reach a two year mark. We had to close both doors,” the retired ...

title: Zaza Pachulia Retires, Joins Warriors As Consultant – SLAM
snippet: Pachulia, 34, won a pair of titles with the Warriors in 2017 and 2018 but saw his veteran role diminish in his lone year with the Pistons. His retirement as a player comes after 16 seasons in the league, many of them as a starting center.

title: Two-time NBA champion Zaza Pachulia says losing more than $100,000 made him a better investor
snippet: Zaza Pachulia retired from the NBA in 2019 after 16 seasons, two championships and about $60 million in career earnings.
